condition.ab: Light brown papyrus. The original cutting lines have been preserved at the top and bottom. The left and right sides are broken off resulting in a loss of two to three letters on the right and two to three words on the left side.

handDesc.p: Written in black ink with a thin pen perpendicular to the fibers on Recto, parallel to the fibers on the verso. The ink has faded in places. There are some diacritical dots. In several places, the scribe extended below the line before writing the final tooth of letters (l. 6 s��hibuhu; katabtu; l. 12 yaghiba; l. 15 rahmat).
